alert.note: Alert for Baker; Hamilton; Northern Columbia; Southern Columbia; Suwannee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 6:57PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Baker, central Columbia, central Suwannee and southeastern Hamilton Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 656 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Taylor to Dowling Park. Movement was east to southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds around 40 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lake City, Live Oak, White Springs, Winfield, Olustee, Suwannee Valley, Luraville, Wellborn, Five Points and Watertown. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northern and northeastern Florida.

area.areaDesc: Baker; Hamilton; Northern Columbia; Southern Columbia; Suwannee
